intro: Convolvulus lanuginosus f. glabrescens, commonly known as the silky morning glory, is a variant of the silky nightshade plant. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are typically covered in fine, soft pubescence. The flowers are usually pale pink to white, with five spreading lobes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a climbing plant that can reach lengths of up to several meters, using its tendrils to support itself on structures or other plants.
